name: Introduction to Anthropology of Religion
description: A course introducing the basic concepts and theories within the field of Anthropology of Religion. Covers foundational literature, theories, and methods.

name: History of Witchcraft
description: A course exploring the interconnected histories of witchcraft, magic, and sorcery. Discusses the construction of gender, sexuality, and power within the field.

name: Anthropology of Rituals
description: A course focusing on the study of rituals and their contexts. Explores how rituals can be used to construct and reinforce gender, class, and power.

name: Anthropology of Beliefs
description: A course exploring the anthropological approach to the study of beliefs and belief systems. Explores the social, cultural, and political implications of belief systems.
